Job Description:
GALE is a creative media consultancy that brings business insights to brand storytelling and activates it across every channel. With expertise in business strategy, media, CRM, addressable and integrated brand communications, performance marketing, and technology, GALE creates marketing systems and communications that grow businesses. GALE delivers strong outcomes for its partners in automotive, QSR, retail, gaming, entertainment, telecom and more. Founded in 2014, the agency currently has offices in New York, Detroit, Singapore, Toronto, Austin, Los Angeles, London, and Bengaluru.

AdVon Commerce started with a vision: Solve e-commerce problems for retailers and publishers.
Our customers are so happy with our technology and are constantly asking us to expand our offerings. Hence, AdVon is pushing to increase the speed, efficiency, and resiliency of all our software. Armed with great technical talent our expanded product offering will be designed for the cloud and automatically handle infrastructure, optimization, availability, data protection, and more, so our publishers and retailers can focus on their core competencies, not managing tech solutions.
In our effort to expand the AdVon product offering we are actively hiring talented senior software engineers who can be part of a world class team which is already building a whole new product area for AdVon. This role is a unique opportunity to make a significant impact on our elastic, large scale, high-performance computing environment.

At Ezoic, we build a platform to help online publishers (i.e. Internet websites) improve their monetization and ensure a fantastic user experience. Our all-in-one digital publishing platform offers a comprehensive suite of tools that automate many of the technical aspects of running a successful website so publishers can focus on connecting with their audience and writing great content.
Artificial Intelligence is at the core of everything that we do, and we are looking for a motivated, creative, results-oriented data scientist to develop novel, scalable models that improve website experiences for tens of millions of visitors each day. This is a high-impact position that will contribute to the very heart of our product.
What you'll do:
Develop machine learning models using our in-house neural network architecture, open-source tools, or custom solutions built from scratch.

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. About the Role:
The position creates new footprint for data-driven innovation and value for our customers and prospects while providing analytical capabilities. You would be part of core team that would help design and develop advanced analytics solutions across functional areas as per client requirement/opportunities. Key requirements include an ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis with a lucid, precise, clear and actionable insight. You should be experienced in solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches. You would also invest your time in developing new practices and methodologies using statistical methods, machine learning and predictive models under mentorship from experts across industry.

Identify and manage the analysis and interpretation of clients' internal and external data to drive decision making.

Utilizes methods particularly in the areas of modeling, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), Deep Learning (DL), Natural Language Processing (NLP) and experience designing/implementing solutions.

About Us
O'Neil Global Advisors (OGA) is an investment advisor that builds algorithmic strategies based on proprietary quantitative factor research pioneered by investing legend William J. O'Neil. Bill's methodology has achieved consistent success over more than five decades, and OGA's strategies provide our clients with an exclusive way to capture the success of his powerful and disciplined approached to investing.We develop strategies that are inspired by Bill's disciplined quantitative approach and incorporate his desire for constant improvement through ongoing backtesting.

At Edward Jones, we help clients achieve their serious, long-term financial goals by understanding their needs and implementing tailored solutions. To ensure a personal client experience, we have located our 14,000+ branch offices where our more than 7 million clients live and work.

A typical branch office has one financial advisor who meets with clients face-to-face and one branch office administrator who enhances the team's ability to build deep relationships with clients. Headquarters associates in St. Louis and Tempe provide support and expertise to help U.S. and Canada branch teams deliver an ideal client experience. Edward Jones currently has more branch offices than any other financial services firm, and we continue to grow to meet the needs of long-term individual investors.

Your Job
This role sits within the SMB Ads Optimization Team. At Indeed, SMB Ads are sponsored jobs created by employers that are looking for the right candidates in Indeed’s marketplace. We decide which sponsored jobs will be presented to job seekers in different channels by considering the employer's willingness to pay. In Indeed’s search, one of Indeed’s main channels, we do this by solving an auction at search time. However, in general, we combine multiple bidding and pricing strategies with optimization algorithms to define the right pricing strategy at the right moment.

As a Data Scientist in the SMB Ads Optimization team, your role is to design and build different mechanisms to find the right value to charge our customers. We are looking for a mixture of statistician, scientist, machine learning expert, and engineer: someone who has passion for building and improving Internet-scale products informed by data. You will be directly influencing Indeed's ads platform's future and responsible for improving our marketplace experimentation strategy. Last but not least, you will spend time understanding and making sense of highly non-linear systems while figuring out how to optimize them.




We are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time.

Overview:
As a Lead Data Scientist, you will be responsible for leading significant role-specific forecasting project work as part of a larger, cross-functional team in support of one or more lines of business. Lead Data Scientists typically leverage and implement pre-defined analytics patterns and infrastructure on projects that are moderately complex, requiring working knowledge of a more limited set of machine learning or advanced modeling forecasting approaches. They must be able to quickly learn new subject-matter in support of a specific project or task. Our Lead Data Scientists typically work with latitude for action or decisions on specific projects, solutions, or technical issues. They may represent Enterprise Analytics, the team's sub-department, in internal conversations. Successful candidates for this role must have strong analytical and research skills, a strong understanding of statistics and statistical modeling, a basic understanding of modern machine learning and its mathematical underpinnings, and they must have moderate programming skills with SQL, R and/or Python. They will need to be fast learners with a keen eye for detail, systems thinking, and process design. They must be team players who work steadfastly to create impactful change. This is a professional track role.
